info.abstract: A learning curve visualizes changes in student performance over time. The line graph displays opportunities across the x-axis, and a measure of student performance along the y-axis. A good learning curve reveals improvement in student performance as opportunity count (i.e., practice with a given knowledge component) increases. This is a python based component. We use the altair package for composing graphs

ul.li: ParametersOptional. Only required when the checkbox for Categorize Learning Curve is checked. Acceptable formats are: XML, outputed by various LearnSphere's AFM workflow components, such as iAFM); and Datashop Model Values export exported from the Model Values tab of the Datashop Learning Curve page. Examples of parameters file: XML format, Datashop Model Values export
An inline HTML file with downloadable images, depicting the requested learning curve(s).
Learning Curve Type: Select from Knowledge Componentes and Students.
Learning Curve Metric: Select from Error Rate, Predicted Error Rate, Assistance Score, Number of Incorrects, Number of Hints, Step Duration, Correct Step Duration and Error Step Duration.
Show Predicted Learning Curve: Only available when Error Rate is selected for Learning Curve Metric. When checked, Predicted Error Rate line is added to the Error Rate line.
Error Bar Type: Select from No Error Bars, Standard Deviation and Standard Error.
Primary Model: The Knowledge Component (KC) model to plot.
View Secondary Model: Flag indicating whether or not to display secondary model curve
Secondary model:A secondary KC to include on graph
Opportunity Cut Off Max: A maximum number of opportunities a student must have had with a KC for the student-KC pair to be included in the graph.
Opportunity Cut Off Min: A minimum number of opportunities a student must have had with a KC for the student-KC pair to be included in the graph.
Categorize Learning Curve: Flag indicating whether or not to categorize the generated learning curves

LC Category Student Threshold: The categorization algorithm first discards points in each curve based on the student threshold. If a point has fewer than the student threshold, it is ignored. (default: 10)
LC Category Opportunity Threshold: Then, if the number of points is below the opportunity threshold, then that curve has Too Little Data. (default: 3)
LC Category Low Error Threshold: Next, if all points on the curve are beneath the low error threshold, then the curve is Low and Flat. (default: 20.0)
LC Category High Error Threshold: Then, if all point on the curve are above the high error threshold, then the curve is Still High. (default: 40.0)

LC Category AFM Slope Threshold: Then, if the slope of the predicted learning curve (as determined by the AFM algorithm) is below the AFM slope threshold, then the curve shows No Learning. (default: 0.001)
